author: Kotipelto (Guest)
title: Help with Blackberry Storm 9500 in Ubuntu 8.10
text:
Hi, first of all I am grateful for your efforts in getting something like this to work. 

I am currently in Ecuador and I am trying to get the app to work for Porta.

I modified the chat file and the other file and I will paste the results below, but my problem seems to be before it even gets there. 

I am currently using a Blackberry Storm on Ubuntu 8.10 and I have installed Barry but never really used it. When I run the "sudo python bbtether.py porta -v" command, I get the following...

Looking for USB devices:
	Bus 007 Device 002: ID 0fca:8007
	Bus 007 Device 001: ID 1d6b:0002
	Bus 006 Device 001: ID 1d6b:0001
	Bus 005 Device 001: ID 1d6b:0001
	Bus 003 Device 002: ID 04f2:b018
	Bus 003 Device 001: ID 1d6b:0002
	Bus 002 Device 002: ID 147e:2016
	Bus 002 Device 001: ID 1d6b:0001
	Bus 004 Device 001: ID 1d6b:0001
	Bus 001 Device 001: ID 1d6b:0001

Increasing USB power - for charging
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "bbtether.py", line 139, in <module>
    BBTether()
  File "bbtether.py", line 77, in __init__
    bb_usb.set_bb_power(berry)
  File "/home/kotipelto/Downloads/bbtether/bb_usb.py", line 143, in set_bb_power
    device.handle.controlMsg(0x40, 0xA2, buffer, 0 , 1)
usb.USBError: error sending control message: Broken pipe


I modified the bb_usb.py file and changed the following entries:

PRODUCT_NEW_9500=0x8007   #(Storm 9500) #line 15

and

if(berry.idProduct == PRODUCT_NEW_9500): #line 74
		type="9500" #line 75

I still get the same exact problem, and I am not sure if what I changed is ok but I am trying :) (I have very little if any experience with programming)

In any regards, I was wondering if you could give me a hand with this and if there is anything else I can provide you with that may help you help me I will be glad to do so.

Best Regards,

Daniel
